name: rechristen
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to give someone or something a new name: [ + two objects ] He had re-christened himself "Yan", but his real name was Ian Brook. The school board was rechristened as the State Board of Education. He bought a yacht, renovated it, and rechristened it.
More examplesFewer examplesDuring the First World War, hamburgers were rechristened "liberty burgers" in the US, to avoid any association with Germany.The villages were nearly all rechristened by European missionaries.The church has been renovated and re-christened "the Hub".
